content.question: The second derivative of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f double prime of x, equals, x squared times the cosine of open parenthesis, the square root of x, close parenthesis, minus 2 x times the cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, close parenthesis, plus the cosine of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. At what values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 3, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> does the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have a point of inflection?

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
